Problem:
Consider a function \\( z(w) \\) which maps complex numbers under the transformation \\(z(w) = e^{iw}\\). We study its effects on waves modeled by the integral transformation \\(x(t) = \\int_{-\\pi}^{\\pi} z(w)e^{iwt} dw\\).

After observing \\(x(t)\\) at time T, can one determine the initial form of the wave function before the transformation \\(z(w)\\) was applied?
Explanation: Since the transformation \\(e^{iw}\\) modifies each frequency component's phase, it is generally not possible to uniquely reconstruct the original wave form solely from the transformed waveform at a later time, especially without knowledge of the phases affected by the initial transformation.
